H0.text: Base indicates that a substance has a pH value greater than 7.

H1.text: Acidic indicates that a substance has a pH value greater than 7.

H2.text: Neutral indicates that a substance has a ph value greater than 7.

H3.text: Volatile is the indication that a substance has a pH value greater than 7.

A4.text: At 25 °C (77 °F), solutions of which the pH is less than 7 are acidic, and solutions of which the pH is greater than 7 are basic.

A5.text: Pure water has a pH of 7 at 25 °C, meaning it is neutral.
